BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1: TRUSTEES OF THE HAMLINE UNIVERSITY OF MINNESOTA

BusinessOfficerGrp.PersonTitleTxt: SR VP for Business Finance Tech

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Hamline University is a nationally ranked comprehensive university serving 5,000 students in its College of Liberal Arts, School of Education, School of Business and School of Law. It offers undergraduate, masters, doctorate and professional degrees, as well as certificate and continuing studies programs.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The mission of the university is to create a diverse and collaborative community of learning dedicated to the development of students' knowledge, values and skills for successful lives of leadership, scholarship and service.
IRS990.Desc: Hamline University is a nationally ranked comprehensive university serving about 5,000 students in its College of Liberal Arts, School of Education, School of Business and School of Law. It offers undergraduate, masters, doctorate and professional degrees, as well as certificates and continuing studies programs. Founded in 1854, Hamline was the first institution of higher learning in Minnesota. During the past 160 years, Hamline has established a national reputation for academic quality, as well as providing students with personal attention and exceptional experiences. Hamline is one of only 283 Phi Beta Kappa institutions in the United States. Among comprehensive universities, US News and World Reports ranks Hamline first in Minnesota for its undergraduate programs. Hamline is ranked fourteenth in the nation by Washington Monthly's College Rankings of service-oriented schools. The School of Law's Alternative Dispute Resolution Program is ranked fourth in the nation by US News and World Report. Hamline University is recognized as a diverse, learning-centered university that is rooted in a tradition of excellence in teaching, research and scholarship. Among its longstanding values are commitments to rigorous academics, creation, dissemination, and practical application of knowledge; multicultural competencies; the development and education of the whole person; and an ethic of social justice and civic responsibility.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Academic support - administrative support functions such as libraries that are directly related to instructional programs.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Student services - expenditures of those offices and activities whose primary purpose is to contribute to students' well-being and development.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: Auxiliaries - Expenditures for primarily student housing, etc.
Other Program Services - Expenditures of those offices and activities whose primary purpose is to support the program activities of the University.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: Vice President for Business Finance and Technology
Dean of the School of Business

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The University is a member of Minnesota Private College Council (MPCC), an organization described in section 501(c)(4) of the Internal Revenue Code. MPCC is an association of private nonprofit institutions of higher education that serves a variety of its members' shared needs, including, but not only, nonpartisan and non-electoral advocacy for public policy that meets students' needs and advances the interests of private higher education. The University paid membership dues to MPCC in the amount of $149,328 during the taxable year. MPCC has divided its expenses for its taxable year ending June 30, 2014, into two groups. Group 1 consists of those expenses that did not in any way support attempts to influence legislation within the meaning of section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code (lobbying), and Group 2 consists of all other expenses. Group 2 includes many expenses, such as personnel costs, that supported both lobbying and nonlobbying activities. MPCC did not attempt to allocate the Group 2 expenses between lobbying and nonlobbying activities. MPCC has determined that the amount of the Group 2 expenses represents 71.55% of the amount of the dues that MPCC collected in the same taxable year. Assuming that all Group 2 expenses were paid from member dues, and allocating those expenses pro rata based on the dues paid by each member, $106,844 of the University's dues were used to pay Group 2 expenses. The amount of lobbying expenses paid from the University's dues was significantly less than that amount.

The University's collections, which were acquired through purchases and contributions since the University's inception, are not recognized as assets on the balance sheet. Purchases of collection items are recorded as decreases in unrestricted net assets in the year in which the items are acquired or as temporarily restricted net assets if the assets are used to purchase the items are restricted by donors. Contributed collection items are not reflected on the financial statements. Proceeds from de-accessions or insurance recoveries are reflected as increases in the appropriate net asset classes.

The University's collection are made up of pottery, prints, musical instruments, and paintings that are held for educational and performance purposes. Each of the items is catalogued, preserved and cared for, and activities verifying their existence and assessing their condition are performed continuously.

The intended uses of the endowment funds are to establish a scholarship or prize, to create a chair in a specific academic area, to fund a particular research program, to fund other programs such as professorships, fellowships, library, buildings, equipments and lectures and discretionary use by the president (unrestricted).

Hamline publicizes its racially nondiscriminatory position in all major publications, including those related to admission and student services and Hamline Magazine as well as on the University website.
The University receives federal and state funding.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Financial Aid office determines student eligibility for federal, state and institutional scholarships according to the University's established criteria which follows federal and state guidelines for awarding grant funds. There is an annual audit to ensure compliance with these regulations.

A written contract between the University and its President provides for a non-fixed payment. This payment is reflected in Schedule J, Part II, Column B (ii).

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The University received two gifts of property that will be held in the collections of the school. The items were a rare book and a basketball uniform with an accompanying photo.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Trustees of the Hamline University are elected by the Board of Trustees and ratified by the Minnesota Annual Conference of the United Methodist Church. The President of the University and the Bishop of the Conference are Ex Officio Trustees with full voting powers.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Form 990 was reviewed by management and audit committee prior to being filed with the IRS. The Form 990 was provided to the Board of Trustees.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Audit Committee of the Board of Trustees is responsible for monitoring and responding to conflicts of interest. An individual with a conflict is required to abstain from discussions and voting on the issue.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The determination of compensation for the individuals identified included review and approval by independent persons, review of comparability data and contemporaneous substantiation of the decision.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Hamline University's governing documents are available at the Minnesota Secretary of State's office. Hamline University's financial statements are available on its website. Hamline University's Form 990 is available at Guidestar.org or upon request. Hamline University's conflict of interest policy is available to the public on its website.
This reflects a loss on an uncollectable pledge to the University.

ReasonableCauseExplanation.ExplanationTxt: An extension Form 8868 was filed and approved by the IRS on October 20, 2014.
